pr_title: xds: implement routing policy with all supported types of matcher

timeline.message: Implement matches() API on RouteMatch for path and header matchings.
Implement a SubchannelPicker that wraps all pickers given by routed child policies and pick is delegated to the one based on matching path/headers rules.
Implement a SubchannelPicker that wraps all pickers given by routed child policies and pick is delegated to the one based on matching path/headers rules.

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText:
It is specified by proto:

The entire request header value must represent an integer in base 10 notation: consisting of an optional plus or minus sign followed by a sequence of digits. The rule will not match if the header value does not represent an integer. Match will fail for empty values, floating point numbers or if only a subsequence of the header value is an integer.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: I think that "integer" in the spec is not Java Integer. The type is Int64, corresponding to Java Long.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: What if headerMatcher.presentMatch.equals(Boolean.FALSE)? Or what if headerMatcher.presentMatch.equals(Boolean.TRUE) and headerMatcher.isInvertedMatch is true?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: We should prepend '/' to args.getMethodDescriptor().getFullMethodName(), because the route's path or prefix in TD's config will always start with '/'. @menghanl Can you confirm?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Path starts with "/", as defined in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/PROTOCOL-HTTP2.md#requests
replies.author: menghanl

replies.bodyText:
Path starts with "/", as defined in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/PROTOCOL-HTTP2.md#requests

Yeah, java MethodDescriptor.getFullMethodName() does not include the leading '/', so we need prepend it.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: Fix header matching presence matcher case.
Match full method name with a prepend slash

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: Why not just use Set<T> Collections.singleton(T o)
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: I would not execute childLb.handleResolvedAddresses() when this.childLbStates and this.routes are in a half-baked state. In extreme case childLb.handleResolvedAddresses() may trigger balancing state update inline.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: Pass addresses to downstream policies asynchornously that delays subchannel state updates.
